---
date: '2025-07-09'
modified_time: 2025-07-09 15:35:19-04:00
published_time: 2025-07-09 15:00:29-04:00
source_url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/07/trust-in-trump-sentiment-surges-as-economy-booms/
tags: articles
title: 'TRUST IN TRUMP: Sentiment Surges as Economy Booms'
---
 
When President Donald J. Trump unveiled his historic America First
[trade
agenda](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/04/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-declares-national-emergency-to-increase-our-competitive-edge-protect-our-sovereignty-and-strengthen-our-national-and-economic-security/)
in April, he [offered some free
advice](https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/114296801411259400):
“Don’t be Weak! Don’t be Stupid! Don’t be a PANICAN … Be Strong,
Courageous, and Patient, and GREATNESS will be the result!”

**President Trump was right (again).**

-   **Wall Street sentiment is surging as the stock market reaches new**
    [**record**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1938702910986317825)
    [**highs**](https://x.com/RapidResponse47/status/1939781868200595882)**.**
    [JPMorgan Chase &
    Co.](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-06-06/jpmorgan-u-turns-on-stock-market-now-sees-slight-gain-for-2025),
    [Goldman Sachs](https://archive.ph/rEX6F),
    [Citigroup](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/06/09/citigroup-joins-chorus-of-wall-street-banks-and-hikes-sp-500-target.html),
    [Deutsche
    Bank](https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/deutsche-bank-lifts-sp-500-year-end-target-amid-wall-street-upgrade-wave-2025-06-03/),
    [UBS Global Wealth
    Management](https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/ubs-lifts-sp-500-indexs-annual-target-fading-trade-tensions-2025-06-27/),
    and
    [Barclays](https://www.reuters.com/business/barclays-lifts-sp-500-year-end-target-6050-2025-06-04/)
    have all elevated their S&P 500 Index year-end targets — now
    predicting record gains to continue.
-   **Consumer outlook is on the rise.** With core inflation at its
    [lowest
    level](https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/06/under-president-trump-america-is-defeating-inflation/)
    since March 2021, expectations for an inflation spike have
    “[completely
    receded](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/07/08/inflation-expectations-drift-back-down-to-pre-tariff-levels-new-york-fed-survey-shows.html)”
    as Americans
    [grow](https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/05/consumer-confidence-surges-majority-says-were-on-right-track/)
    [increasingly](https://www.cnn.com/2025/06/13/economy/consumer-sentiment-may)
    [confident](https://www.reuters.com/business/us-consumers-happier-about-finances-expect-stable-inflation-new-york-fed-says-2025-07-08/)
    about the economic outlook.
-   **Price hikes never materialized.** A [new
    study](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Imported-Goods-Have-Been-Getting-Cheaper-Relative-to-Domestically-Produced-Goods.pdf)
    found that prices for imported goods have actually declined *faster*
    than prices for overall goods — confirming that tariffs have had
    little effect on prices.
-   **By all metrics, President Trump is overseeing another economic
    boom.** Jobs numbers have trounced expectations for [four straight
    months](https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/07/june-boom-jobs-report-shows-the-economy-continues-to-soar-under-president-trump/),
    gas prices remain at their [lowest
    level](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/06/28/gas-prices-will-be-the-cheapest-theyve-been-in-years-expert-says.html)
    in four years, and blue-collar wage growth has seen the [largest
    increase](https://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/2025/06/icymi-blue-collar-wage-growth-sees-largest-increase-in-nearly-60-years-under-trump/)
    in nearly 60 years.
